wikipedia_page.main: John E. Amoore (1930-1998) was a British biochemist who first proposed the stereochemical theory for olfaction.

response: *John E. Amoore (1939–1998), British biochemist and zoologist, originator of the stereochemical theory of olfaction.
* John E. Amoore (1939–1998). British biochemist and zoologist at the University of California, Berkeley, who postulated the stereochemical theory of olfaction.
